# Materials for today

Materials for today can be found at [https://github.com/jadeynryan/fs-rladies-sl](https://github.com/jadeynryan/fs-rladies-sl)

<br>

To follow along today you will need the following things:

- RStudio and R 
- Packages: fs, stringr, janitor


# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

-   R-Ladies is a world-wide organization with the mission of promoting **gender diversity in the R community**

-   Started in San Francisco in 2012 and now has **225 chapters** globally (check out [rladies.org](https://rladies.org/) for more information)

-   R-Ladies is rebranding to `R-Ladies+` in order to be more inclusive of all underrepresented genders in the R community. You can read more about this transition [here](https://rladies.org/news/rebranding-rladies/).

![](img/rladies2023.jpg){fig-align="center"}

# About today's speaker

- Jadey Ryan is a data scientist with the Washington State Department of Agriculture and an occasional data freelancer.
- She’s an R enthusiast passionate about building efficient, beautiful data products and decision-support tools, especially with Quarto and Shiny. 
- When she’s not coding, she enjoys good food, the outdoors, and time with her husband, daughter, and three cats.
